alert.note: Alert for Coeur d'Alene Area (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 3:18PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kootenai County through 300 PM PDT... At 217 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Harrison, or 11 miles south of Coeur d`Alene. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Kootenai County. This includes U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 416 and 421. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. The storm may produce gusty winds on Lake Coeur d`Alene as well and boaters should seek shelter.
